intro: Myzorrhiza californica, commonly known as the California myzorrhiza, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Myzorrhiza californica is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
